Package squidpony.squidai.astar

Class DefaultGraph

java.lang.Object
squidpony.squidai.astar.DefaultGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<Coord>
public class DefaultGraph
extends Object
implements Graph<Coord>
A convenient implementation of Graph for Coord nodes; this also allows constructing a Graph with a 2D char array like those produced all over SquidLib. Some predefined heuristics are available as static constants here. You can "show" a DefaultGraph in conjunction with a Pathfinder, which appends a big grid of node costs matching the Pathfinder to a StringBuilder.

  • Field Details

    • MANHATTAN

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> MANHATTAN
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing twice as much as orthogonal movement. This is a good choice for graphs where only four-way movement is used.

    • CHEBYSHEV

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> CHEBYSHEV
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing the same as orthogonal movement. This is only suggested for graphs where eight-way movement is used, and it may produce erratic paths compared to EUCLIDEAN.

    • EUCLIDEAN

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> EUCLIDEAN
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where all movement is calculated "as-the-crow-flies," using the standard Pythagorean formula for distance as in the real world. This does not make diagonal connections, if they are allowed, actually cost more or less, but they won't be preferred if an orthogonal route can be taken. This is recommended for graphs where eight-way movement is used.

    • DIJKSTRA

      public static final Heuristic<Coord> DIJKSTRA
      A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where the heuristic is not used, and all cells are considered equivalent regardless of actual distance.

    • HEURISTICS

      public static final List<Heuristic<Coord>> HEURISTICS

    • positions

      public Arrangement<Coord> positions

    • allConnections

      public ArrayList<List<Connection<Coord>>> allConnections

      public int height

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph()
      Creates an empty DefaultGraph with capacity 16; you must call init(char[][], boolean) or otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it. The capacity is expected to resize to fit a typically-much-larger map.

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(int capacity)
      Creates an empty DefaultGraph with the given minimum capacity; you must call init(char[][], boolean) or otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it.
      Parameters:
      capacity - how many nodes, approximately, to expect in the map

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(char[][] map)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(char[][], boolean), with eightWay set to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(char[][], boolean).
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(double[][] costs)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(double[][], boolean), with eightWay set to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
      Parameters:
      costs - a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell

    • DefaultGraph

      public DefaultGraph​(double[][] costs, boolean eightWay)
      Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using init(double[][], boolean).
      Parameters:
      costs - a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
      Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store the ones in the latest map. The map should use # for walls and impassable areas; all other chars will be considered equally passable.
      Parameters:
      map - a char[][] where # is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

    • init

      public void init​(double[][] costs, boolean eightWay)
      Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store the ones in the latest map. The double[][] costs stores the costs to enter cells; it is typically produced by DungeonUtility.generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double). Negative values in costs mark cells that cannot be entered (like walls); 1.0 is used for normal cells that can be entered easily, and higher values mark more challenging cells to enter.
      Parameters:
      costs - a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell
      eightWay - if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells

    • getConnections

    • show

      public StringBuilder show​(StringBuilder sb, Pathfinder<Coord> pathfinder, Pathfinder.Metrics metrics)
      Given a StringBuilder to append to, a Pathfinder with Coord nodes that has run and at least attempted to find a path, and the Pathfinder.metrics that the Pathfinder must have been configured to record, this makes a textual representation of the explored nodes and appends it to the StringBuilder. This shows the actual costs of all explored nodes in the Pathfinder for its latest path. If you intend to show a DefaultGraph like this, the Pathfinder must be constructed with Pathfinder(Graph, boolean) where calculateMetrics is true (or where Pathfinder.metrics was assigned new Pathfinder.Metrics() before calculating a path). This will vary in displayed width based on the maximum width required to print any node, so if the longest-distance node costs 100 to enter, the displayed width will be longer than if the longest-distance node only cost 99. Any unvisited nodes, including walls and out-of-the-way areas, will be shown with some number of '#' chars. Spaces will separate nodes on the same line.
      Parameters:
      sb - a StringBuilder that will be appended to and returned
      pathfinder - a Pathfinder that must have at least tried to find a path (and must have metrics, see below)
      metrics - the Metrics for the above Pathfinder, which are required to be non-null when the path was tried
      Returns:
      the StringBuilder, after appending what is usually a lot of text in a grid
